Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a continuation of restrictive measures introduced during Covid-19.
The proposal is compared to totalitarian regimes, suggesting it undermines democratic processes.
Concerns that the government and media will act as arbiters of truth, leading to censorship and control of free speech.
Notable Quotes: The proposed Communications Legislation Amendment (Combatting Misinformation and Disinformation) Bill 2023 appears to be a continuation of the appalling and draconian playbook that was unleashed during Covid-19.
It is so far removed from the more democratic processes Australians were accustomed to pre-Covid, and much more aligned with the totalitarian measures of Hitler, Stalin and Mao.
This proposed legislation is extremely dangerous and I will not be voting for any party that supports it.
